rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Such an intelligent man.  Gives excellent feedback on papers and his lectures are brilliant.  Can't wait to take another class with him.

His lectures are really long and dragged out. He uses confusing and complicated diction and unnecessary comments. I learned most from recitation (recommend Melanie Ungar if she's still there). One group project, a few short papers, and two exams (midterm and final). MUST DO THE READINGS!!

Fantastic professor. Welcoming but somewhat intimidating in office hours: he doesn't just hand stuff to his students. Overall, the best class and professor I have had so far at Chapel Hill. He really knows his stuff, including topics that it seems wouldn't be his main field. Excellent feedback on papers. Careful, precise, and flexible instructor.

Sat in front of the room and had a conversation with the other prof, mostly about how difficult the subject material was. Made no effort to make the material understandable. If you visited him in his office, even with an appointment, he practically pushed you out the door as soon as you walked in. Has NO interest in helping struggling students.
Eric Downing is the reason I am a comparative literature major.  He is EXCELLENT!!!
Professor Downing was by far the best literature teacher I've had at UNC.  I loved his verbosity!
he can be a bit verbose, but the assignments were easy and he was very helpful and easy to get in contact with.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Professor Fisher is arguably one of the worst professors I have ever had. The class was extremely unorganized and in the span of two days we had 18 pages of writing assigned to us simply because she could not keep up with her earlier deadlines. Although she is certainly intelligent, she shows no signs of making her class a priority. DO NOT TAKE

She is very smart, but sometimes too much for the good of the class. Never returns papers that are assigned, and moved around deadlines and assignments because she took so long grading papers. The class on a day to day basis was discussion. You have to keep up with the reading because she randomly calls on students!

She is very smart but doesn't convey the material well. Some of the things she taught didn't seem relevant to what the class was supposed to be about. When she spoke to you it seemed like she was speaking down to you. She had an arrogant air about her when she talked and it made me wary/ uncomfortable to go to her for help.

Dr. Fisher is intelligent, and expects a TON from her students.  I think that the course load was extremely high for a first-year seminar.  Also, Dr. Fisher is not an easy grader by any stretch of the imagination.  If you are a freshman looking for a stress-free seminar, this might not be the one for you.  Although, you would certainly learn a lot!

Like others have said, she's a very intelligent and well spoken woman. I definitely learned a lot from her. I do think she expects too much and grades papers hard. You cannot miss more than 2 classes without having your grade lowered & you MUST keep up with readings because she will call on anyone at anytime.

took Intro to Literary Criticism with her and was blown away. Her class is intense - you're very much expected to participate, so you better keep up with the readings. She's a brilliant professor and incredibly well spoken, and she definitely wants her students to succeed. Try to take a class with her if you can!

Dr. Fisher was an amazing teacher - incredibly smart (almost too smart) and interesting, but I found the courseload way too high for a first year seminar. I learned a lot and I think I'm a better writer because of the class, but if you're interested in her class be prepared to write a TON.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Extremely nice guy and very knowledgeable, but his lectures are all over the place. He talks himself in a circle and is difficult to follow

Personable, funny, and serious as hell, Shayne is truly one of UNC's best. He explains dense and complicated topics with an unparalleled combination of specificity and accessibility. He's genuinely interested and committed to his students and their scholarship; office hours are frequently extended so that all seeking help get it. Brilliant prof!

Hands down, Shayne will be the best professor you've ever had. And the hardest. He is ALWAYS available to talk, really wants you to understand, and grades kindly if you show you care. Prepare to bust your ass doing tons of really dense readings and rewriting your papers at least 3 times, but it will be the most rewarding experience of your life!

This guy is probably the most intelligent professor I've encountered in 6 years at this school. For his age, he has such a vast knowledge of his field that it is almost hard to keep up with the discussions, but that's not his fault. Extremely helpful, the classes are NOT hard, make use of his office hours. An awesome prof.

Awesome teacher!  My first class in which I can truly say that I had fun while learning.  He can be a bit tough but you will learn a great deal.  Participate in class and make use of his office hours.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: She is rude, unhelpful, impolite, seems like she doesn't care about the students nor the material, gives students attitude.
She does not explain things well and seems to hate her job (ie teaching).  She is rude and never willing to help you with individual problems.

Antle's a good professor, very interested in what she teaches and usually engaging in class.  Although she's not a tough grader, the workload for this class was overwhelming: 5 novels and 9 films (that's just outside of class.  Expect to be interested, but also expect to do an unusually large amount of reading and writing papers.

Martine is a great professor - very fun, interesting, and I felt that I learned a lot from the class, as well. The homework load was kind of heavy toward the beginning of the semester, but after 1.5 months it seemed as if we barely had any homework at all. A great class, learned a lot, and she was fantastic.
She's definitely less than organized but classes are relaxed and interesting.
One of the absolute best professors I've had at UNC. I'd take anything she taught.

Excellent professor.  She is very receptive to students' ideas and encourages independent research.  She has also helped me a great deal with my thesis, even though she isn't on my committee.  She is a very dedicated professor who goes above and beyond the call of duty, and she is a wonderful person to work with both in and out fo the classroom.

Madame Antle is an amazing professor. Her enthusiam and hilarious comments keep class time exciting, and her extensive knowledge of the French language is extremely helpful when trying to grasp the language. Always accessible and always more than willing to help. I would definitely recommend her.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: I had her for my first semester of my freshman year and I don't think I will ever have another professor as great as her in my next three years at UNC. She has the most fascinating insight and despite the heavy workload, is extremely understanding if something goes wrong. She really cares about her students being successful

You better like Jane Austen. A terrific class and professor, however, and we got to meet her family and go to her house on multiple occasions. The class was more work than most first year seminars, but she has so much passion and such a sweet personality.

Massive amounts of reading - I wasn't prepared.  Tests came out of nowhere and were very difficult to do well on.  Brodey is the nicest, calmest, most chill professor I have ever had though, and actual class time is extremely low-key.  Honestly would not take again though because Jane Austen does not interest me.  NEED to love Austen to take!

Dr. Brodey is an excellent professor, who integrates literature and art in variety of mediums into her classes. While she produces cutting-edge research, I always found her approachable, and she helped me improve my writing a great deal. A fair bit of reading, but very interesting. Looking forward to my third class with her!

I loved this class so much. I didn't even really know what it was all going to be about when I first signed up but I really enjoyed her as a teacher. There is a lot of reading and it is difficult but I think it is worth it. She is very helpful and let us come over to her house for a movie for the class! Would recommend her as a teacher.
This class was awesome. One of the best classes ever.

This has been my favorite class thus far. She taught the class with James Thompson, and they both enjoyed what they were teaching so much and had such a rapport with one another that I looked forward to coming each day. She was incredibly caring and really developed a relationship with each of the students. Basically, she was wonderful!

I had her for ASIA/CMPL 379: Cowboys, Samurai and Rebels. The topic is absolutely fascinating, but she is completely boring. There are approx 10 required books ($$$) and almost a movie a week required to watch. WAY TOO TIME CONSUMING! however, the grades are controlled by TA's and mine is fair...

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Dr. Wolfe is really great! Knows her stuff, and is super passionate about it. ENGL 120 has some pretty dry material, but she makes it bearable. Super understanding of how busy our schedules can be, and is always willing to meet and go above and beyond to help you.

Take a class with her! She is one of the best professors I have had at UNC, and is both a true scholar and a dedicated, kind person who cares about students.  She's willing to meet & edit your papers all of the time, and has even told us that she grades all of the papers in her lectures. Very passionate about literature and helps you dive into it.

A fantastic professor that is an expert on her subject. She will keep you engaged and passionate about her class. I strongly recommend that you fight to get into a small, honors class with her, because she will edit all papers and meet anytime.  I would recommend her to anyone, and you should take multiple classes with her because she gives recs.

Dr. Wolfe is absolutely brilliant and one of my favorite professors at UNC. I knew very little about the topic of classical poetry before taking her class and now I have several new favorite authors and topics. She is sure to keep you engaged, expose new interests, and help you dive into the ancient texts. Have fun!

Absolutely brilliant professor. So knowledgeable and always gives very interesting lectures. Class had 3 essays and an essay-based final, so very writing intensive. She is very accessible and helpful with these papers. Overall, a must have professor at least once.

Professor Wolfe is such an interesting professor. She really knows her stuff and I learned a ton from her class. Lectures are very interesting, though recitation kind of sucks. She grades papers pretty critically, but if you take time on it you can get a B easy. Final was a take home paper, which is great. Overall, great experience.

Jessica Wolfe is one of the best professors for comparative literature/english at UNC. Her teaching style is pretty unique (she speaks really fast!) but its not unfollowable. Keep up with the reading and you should be fine.

Professor Wolfe was very enthusiastic and occasionally humorous. During the last lecture, she said the material wouldn't appear on the final exam, and she joked, "This is the part where half of the class is supposed to leave," but everyone stayed. The text was difficult to understand, but she clarifies the text in class. Beware: She does talk fast.

I really just can't say enough good things about Jessica Wolfe. She honestly opened my mind to an entire genre -- I used to find classic, epic literature dry and dull, and she revealed the complexity in each novel. What a great professor! So smart, approachable and cool. Can I be her when I grow up?

Dr. Wolfe is by far one of the best teachers I've ever had. She is a brilliant lecturer and extremely helpful outside of class. Her grading is rough but she makes it so easy to do well by providing so much extra assistance and AMAZINGLY INSIGHTFUL lectures. She talks insanely fast and not a minute of time is wasted but it's all worthwhile. =)

Absolutely brilliant, enthusiastic about what she teaches, engaging and exciting at the same time that she blows your mind with her insights. She goes WAY out of her way to meet with you outside of class. Grades tough but fair, reading is very light (and not even necessary if you pay attention). Serious business, but so nice! A must-take teacher!
No Comments

She's a wolfe in sheep's clothing! Yeah, she looks small and meek, and young for a tenured professor, but this woman really knows her stuff, especially Shakespeare. The only complaint I have is that she doesn't lecture much but spends most of her time on class discussion. Still, one of the best English profs you can get.
She doesn't waste a second of class and flies through her lectures, and she's no pushover.  The final was difficult and she required two long papers.  But she knows her stuff.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Dr. DeGuzman is super helpful and very nice. If you need help on a paper or want to understand the material better she's there to help you out. You have to read the novels to pass, but it's worth it as she chooses some really interesting reads. Not like any American lit class I've taken before. Beware the final though, it's tricky.

Getting Dr. D to direct my honors thesis was the hands down the best academic decision I ever made. I'm a better writer, researcher, and thinker as a result of working with her. It was a lot of work, but it was so fun!

An amazing academic and literary experience. I did not leave her class with a notebook full of notes that would lie forgotten; I left her class with a head full of ideas and new perspectives. She does not give exams, preferring papers instead. She gives a lot of reading, but it is always really engaging. Dr. D is among the best at UNC.

This was, seriously, the most amazing class I've ever taken in my life. I would pretty much do anything to take another course from Professor DeGuzman. She is one of the most intelligent people I've ever met, and she makes an effort to engage all of her students. Funny, makes course work interesting, great class dicussions. TAKE HER CLASSES.
She was sooooo good.  I loved her class.  She keeps you on the edge of your seat all class long... every class!
She was soooooo interesting.  Every class flew by!  You should totally take this professor if you get a chance.
AMAZING!
easy grader on essays, open to questions from students and easy to talk to, but class was boring

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: No Comments

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: One of my FAVORITE professors at UNC! I have taken two of her comparative literature classes (Romancing the World and Don Quixote) and plan to take more if possible. There is a lot to read but her lectures are always so interesting and insightful.

One of my favorite professors so far at UNC. As long as you come to class and do the readings, you will pass. Some of the readings were boring, but others were great and interesting (about half and half). Professor Collins truly cares about each student and what they learn from her. I would take this again.
She is the sweetest teacher. Her tests are very hard/specific, but she grades papers fairly. Lots of reading per class, but I would definitely recommend her!

I was delighted to have my senior seminar with Dr. Collins. For starters, she is SUCH a sweet, ebullient lady. She chose interesting texts, kept class discussions lively, and was reasonable with expectations/feedback. Also super knowledgeable in Renaissance lit and Cervantes.  If I hadn't graduated I'd be in her classes all the time!

I enjoyed this class because I love literature but I have a friend in the class who does not and she thought it was miserably boring. Overall, very easy if you read the books and attend lecture every now and then.

I took CMPL 390 - Don Quixote with Prof Collins and LOVED it. Stay on top of the readings, attend class and participate occasionally and you'll make an A. The tests weren't difficult if you did the reading and paid attention. Prof Collins is incredibly intelligent and very helpful! Definitely take her class!
Collins' lectures are very boring, she reads them directly from a piece of paper and they tend to be pretty unnecessary. You don't have to attend lecture very often to get a good grade in the class.

Dr. Collins is sooooo nice and very helpful. She really knows the material very well, and she is encouraging to all students. I learned so much from her. My only comment is that it would be better if she taught classes all in Spanish instead of English.

Dr. Collins is the best professor! She is very helpful, kind and patient, and she really knows her stuff. She works with both Golden Age and Twentieth Century Spanish lit and is well-versed in both. Her classes are not easy, but they are worth taking, and if you work hard you will do well.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: McGowan has been teaching for a long time and is a walking encyclopedia. His class is discussion style and almost completely run by the students. He does expect you to read just about every night and submit a reading log. The toughest part was how boring and confusing some of the readings were! McGowan is awesome, but the reading selections weren't
I had him for a first-year seminar and it was absolutely amazing. He's the best professor I've had to date and is very forgiving, doesn't throw the book at you just because he can.
Dr. McGowan is terrific.  He is my favorite professor at UNC.  If you pass up a class of his, you are missing out.

A very engaging, shrewd, and yet also self-effacing professor.  You get the impression there's nothing he hasn't already read.  He's an extremely eloquent lecturer capable of making very abstract topics seem graspable.  A tough grader on papers, but reasonable.  I wouldn't hesitate to take another of his classes.
